perturbation.original_text:
6.  USER DATA OWNERSHIP

  a)   Ownership

       i)   The operation of the Co-Branded Application will permit the
                collection of Payment-Eligible User Data.

       ii)  Payment-Eligible URS User Data, Superset Data, and Shopping
                Category Data collected through the operation of the Co-Branded
                Application will be jointly owned by the parties. The parties'
                respective ownership shall be subject to the restrictions set
                forth in this Agreement.


       iii) Transactional Data, when available, shall be jointly owned by
                the parties, except in those cases where Application Provider's
                contractual agreement(s) with its merchant partner(s) prevent
                the sharing of said Transactional Data with third parties. In
                all cases Application Provider shall use commercially reasonable
                efforts to ensure that Transactional Data may be shared with and
                co-owned by Excite@Home. The parties' respective ownership
                rights shall be subject to the restrictions set forth in this
                Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.  USER DATA OWNERSHIP

  a)   Ownership

       i)   The operation of the Co-Branded Application will permit the
                collection of Payment-Eligible User Data.

       ii)  Payment-Eligible URS User Data, Superset Data, and Shopping
                Category Data collected through the operation of the Co-Branded
                Application will be solely owned by Excite@Home. The parties'
                respective ownership shall be subject to the restrictions set
                forth in this Agreement.


       iii) Transactional Data, when available, shall be solely owned by Excite@Home and Application Provider, except in those cases where Application Provider's
                contractual agreement(s) with its merchant partner(s) prevent
                the sharing of said Transactional Data with third parties. In
                all cases Application Provider shall use commercially reasonable
                efforts to ensure that Transactional Data may be shared with and
                co-owned by Excite@Home. The parties' respective ownership
                rights shall be subject to the restrictions set forth in this
                Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Payment-Eligible User Data is jointly owned, creating a collaborative relationship. The modified text changes this, stating that Payment-Eligible User Data is 'solely owned by Excite@Home', which creates a conflict. Moreover, Transactional data says both parties solely own the data but immediately says that data sharing may be prevented. This contradicts that initial ownership statement.

perturbation.original_text: i) Excite@Home shall not offer any Excite-branded or Excite-co-branded         service during the Term of this Agreement that is substantially similar         in functionally to the Co-Branded Application.
perturbation.changed_text: i) Excite@Home shall offer any Excite-branded or Excite-co-branded         service during the Term of this Agreement that is substantially similar         in functionally to the Co-Branded Application.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Excite@Home will not offer services similar in functionality to the Co-Branded Application. The modified text directly contradicts this, now stating that Excite@Home shall offer similar services. This creates direct conflict and uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
15.  TERM

  The term of this Agreement will begin on the Effective Date and will end three (3) years from the date the Co-Branded Application becomes accessible to Excite@Home Members ("Launch Date").
perturbation.changed_text:
15.  TERM

  The term of this Agreement will begin on the Effective Date and will end five (5) years from the date the Co-Branded Application becomes accessible to Excite@Home Members ("Launch Date"). The agreement can be terminated with no penalty at any time.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement ends 3 years from launch date. The modified text changes that to five years while adding that the agreement can be terminated at any time with no penalty. This creates a contradiction in the agreement terms.
